title: Rags Matthews
text:
Raymond "Rags" Matthews (August 17, 1905 – January 2, 1999) was an American <a href="American%20football">football</a> player at <a href="Texas%20Christian%20University">Texas Christian University</a> (TCU) in the 1920s. A <a href="Fort%20Worth%2C%20Texas">Fort Worth, Texas</a> native, Matthews attended <a href="Polytechnic%20High%20School%20%28Fort%20Worth%2C%20Texas%29">Polytechnic High School</a> before TCU. He lettered three times under coach <a href="Matty%20Bell">Matty Bell</a>, during which the <a href="TCU%20Horned%20Frogs%20football">TCU Horned Frogs</a> posted a cumulative record of 17–5–5. He was named the team's Most Valuable Player after the 1926 and 1927 seasons, and was selected to play in the <a href="East-West%20Shrine%20Game">Shrine East-West All-Star Game</a> as a senior in 1927, the first year players from the <a href="Southwest%20Conference">Southwest Conference</a> were included.
Matthews was named to the All-Time All-SWC Team in 1969, and was elected to the <a href="College%20Football%20Hall%20of%20Fame">College Football Hall of Fame</a> in 1971. He died in his hometown at the age of 93 in 1999.
